paper_abstract: A code C subset of Z(2)(n), where Z(2) = {0, 1}, has unidirectional covering radius R if R is the smallest integer so that any word in Z(2)(n) can be obtained from at least one codeword c is an element of C by replacing either is by 0s in at most R coordinates or 0s by is in at most R coordinates. The minimum cardinality of such a code is denoted by E(n, R). Upper bounds on this function are here obtained by constructing codes using tabu search; lower bounds, on the other hand, are mainly obtained by integer programming and exhaustive search. Best known bounds on E(n, R) for n <= 13 and R <= 6 are tabulated.
